items.content:
Annika - week 1 February

  1. Open the PDF file below.
  2. Go to https://quizlet.com/class/1909044/ and make an account.
  3. Design a word list of words from the pdf file. Click on 'Add a set' to do so.
  4. Put the English words in it first and translate the words to Dutch in the other column.
  5. You can also add pictures to the words, this is very useful and makes it easier to remember the words.
  6. When completed, practise your word list by playing Scatter or Gravity or just with the plain old flashcards.

Deadline: Wednesday

Belle - week 1 February

1. work according to the file attached here below

2. show me your work when you're done with one page. Try to work your work onwards.

part 1:

Geerte - week 1 February

  1. Open the PDF file below.
  2. Go to https://quizlet.com/class/1909044/ and make an account.
  3. Practise with the 'examenidioom' of H1

Deadline: Wednesday

See below for part two

part 2:

work in the Everyday English file below. You can work together with Malissa if you want.

Gijs- week 1 February

1. decide if you want to work together with Stijn Pittens, Luc Eppink, Joey or Lars.

2.Open the Word document below and follow the assignment.

When done, please give me feedback on how useful the activity was. You could make a word list of the words you find useful on WRTS when you're done.

Hidde- week 1 February

1. work according to the file attached here below

2. show me your work when you're done with one page. Try to work your work onwards.

Jesper weekly planner;

Work together with Tijn in the Cambridge book Business vocabulary in use.

Choose a unit you like and do the exercises on the righthand side of the page. Write on your laptop or in a notebook.

You could start with chapter 22 on page 52/53 in the textbook about The Four P's (de 4 p's, zoals promotie en plaats...)

Joey- week 1 February

First, choose from the vocabulary assignment(a) or the engineering assignment (b).

A)

1. decide if you want to work together with Stijn Pittens, Luc Eppink, Lars or Gijs .

2.Open the Word document below and follow the assignment.

When done, please give me feedback on how useful the activity was. You could make a word list of the words you find useful on WRTS when you're done.

B)

  1. Open the PDF files below. (There are two types!)
  2. Go to https://quizlet.com/class/1909044/ and make an account.
  3. Design a word list of words from the pdf file. Click on 'Add a set' to do so.
  4. Put the English words in it first and translate the words to Dutch in the other column.
  5. You can also add pictures to the words, this is very useful and makes it easier to remember the words.
  6. When completed, practise your word list by playing Scatter or Gravity or just with the plain old flashcards.

Tijn weekly planner;

Work together with Jesper in the Cambridge book Business vocabulary in use.

Choose a unit you like and do the exercises on the righthand side of the page. Write on your laptop or in a notebook.

When you're done you can practise the fishing vocabulary below.

Tom Gerrits

Tim - Week 1 February 2016

Go to http://themas.studioengels.nl/view?repo=studiovo&comp=eng-hv3-thema1&subcomp=eng-hv3-thema1-C

Work your way through the Introduction and Annoying conversations.

Don't forget to practise the word lists on wrts.nl too. (For example; Me and my phone hv3 reading 3, or click on this link; https://wrts.nl/#/lists/59282517) A quick search on the web page should get the correct word list. (control F and then ME AND MY PHONE HV VOCABULARY READING)

Make sure you show me your progress every once in a while and when you're finished.

Go to http://themas.studioengels.nl/view?repo=studiovo&comp=eng-hv3-thema1&subcomp=eng-hv3-thema1-C

Word list examenidioom

Week 1 February

  2. Practise the word list H1 examenidioom.

items.title: Writing practice
items.description: Read the introduction, then choose between "Email, underage driving or Glastonbury"

items.content:
iPhone apps*

  1. Clear Speech From the Start. (Version 1.01) [iPhone app]. Cambridge University Press. (2011).
  2. English As It Is Broken. (Version 1.1) [iPhone app]. Singapore Press Holdings. (2010).
  3. English File Pronunciation. (Version 1.1) [iPhone app]. Oxford University Press. (2012).
  4. Enunciation. (Version 2.1). [iPhone app]. Kevin Litton. (2011).
  5. Forvo English Pronunciations. (Version 1.1) [iPhone app]. Forvo Media SL. (2011).
  6. Howjsay Pronunciation Dictionary. (Version 4.2) [iPhone app]. Consilium Software. (2009).
  7. iPron. (Version 1.0) [iPhone app]. SoundsEnglish (2009).
  8. Phonetic Focus. (Version 1.3) [iPhone app]. Cambridge English Online Ltd. (2010).
  9. Pronounce English A-Z. (Version 1.2) [iPhone app]. Ahmet CEPNI. (2011).
  10. Pronunciation Power. (Version 1.0.0) [iPhone app]. English Computerized Learning Inc. (2010).
  11. Sounds: The pronunciation App. (Version 2.0.1) [iPhone app]. Macmillan Publishers Ltd. (2011).
